intro: Eminium intortum var. kotschyi, commonly known as the twisted eminium, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its intricate, spiraling growth pattern. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate, lace-like appearance. It is typically found in rocky, arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
